movies.title: 100 Ghost Street: The Return of Richard Speck
movies.plot: In 2010, paranormal investigators tried to film Richard Speck's ghost at the site of his heinous killing spree. The victims' families have finally released the footage that documents their last days.
movies.simplePlot: In 2010, paranormal investigators tried to film Richard Speck's ghost at the site of his heinous killing spree. The victims' families have finally released the footage that documents their last days.

biography.bio: Steve Bencich is a writer and actor, known for Frère des ours (2003), Chicken Little (2005) and Open Season (2006).
biography.name: Steve Bencich

biography.bio: Born into an entrepreneurial family in Omaha, Nebraska, Tony Besson began his life in a constant state of change. Moving between 14 different schools from California to Hawaii, ending in Las Vegas, Tony was always the new kid in school. Due to the need to continually introduce himself, Tony naturally became an outgoing and witty person, which consistently put him in the center of attention. Whether animatedly reenacting a story about a past school to his friends in the cafeteria, or impeccably drifting inches between light poles and cars before e-braking into his spot in the parking lot; when you met Tony, you were not likely to forget him. Tony loved engaging people into his stories and plots, and later realized he had a natural talent for stage, which was for him like telling a story in the cafeteria. However, despite the natural talent of this young man, his aspirations to pursue his passion of acting were hindered by the upheavals of an inconsistent place to call "home." Entering his freshman year of high school, Tony took a stand against his inconsistencies, and enrolled in acting classes to focus on his passion. This however was a short lived commitment, as Tony was forced to move to Las Vegas during his senior year of high school, unwillingly removing him from his acting classes and training. Once in Las Vegas, and starting to "grow-up," Tony embodied the entrepreneurial and independent spirit he had grown up around in his family, and moved out of his loving parent's house at age 17. Tony began his "professional life" managing multiple cell phone accessory stores, until he purchased the company for himself, all before he was 20. With his life following the familiar successful path of his business savvy father, Tony realized he was successful, however not passionate about his work; as his passion was still pursuing a career in acting and that dream was slipping away. So, in 2005 Tony sold his company, packed his life up and moved to Hollywood. It took a few trials in Los Angeles before he made a final and permanent plunge into Hollywood when his hard work began to bring to fruition his dreams. Since being in Hollywood, Tony studied at Howard Fine, completed Improvisation at Groundings, and studied stunts at XMA World Headquarters. His natural talents and desire to learn brought in a fairly consistent string of work including parts in Spiderman 3, episodes on Entourage and Nip/Tuck and several smaller appearances. Still a new actor to Hollywood he still finds himself with streaks of down time in Hollywood, where he enjoys taking those times to engage in classes, international opportunities, as well as returning back "home" to Las Vegas to try and capture some luck, and bring it back to California with him.
biography.name: Tony Besson

biography.bio: Hayley Derryberry is known for her work on Frank (2014), Rabid Love (2013) and Making Time (2014).
biography.name: Hayley Derryberry

biography.bio: Chance Harlem Jr. is known for his work on Charlene (2014), Cat (2016) and Unlawful Justice (2017).
biography.name: Chance Harlem Jr.

biography.bio: Mike Holley is known for his work on Angie Tribeca (2016), Miss Stevens (2016) and Grey's Anatomy (2005).
biography.name: Mike Holley

biography.bio: Jennifer Robyn Jacobs is a Los Angeles based actress. She was born in New York City, and grew up in Allentown, Pennsylvania. One of three children (she has a younger sister and brother), Jennifer was raised by her father following her mother's death from a biking accident when she was 16-years-old. She attributes this accident as the first moment acting fueled her life. After graduating Boston University, Jennifer was discovered by Martin Campbell to be the Stand-In and Double for Mel Gibson's daughter in Graham Kings Edge of Darkness. A few films later, she moved to Los Angeles. Her favorite actress is Marion Cotillard and it is her dream to one day costar with her. Besides acting, Jennifer is an active humanitarian and very passionate about travel. Her recent visits include: India, Morocco, South Africa, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Namibia, Germany, France, among many others.
biography.name: Jennifer Robyn Jacobs

biography.bio: Adam LaFramboise is an actor, known for Bad Gravity (2006), Vacationland (2005) and Live Free or Die (2006).
biography.name: Adam LaFramboise

biography.bio: Nancy Leopardi was born in Trenton, New Jersey on January 14th, 1974. As a child she modeled for commercial and print and attended Catholic school. She began acting while attending The School of Visual Arts in New York City, where she was inspired by the East Village music and film scene. She made her way through school by working at an illegal after hours nightclub called "Save The Robots" and photographing punk and noise bands for a variety of music magazines. After working as the photo editor at Spin Magazine and acting in avant-garde films, she traded New York for Los Angeles where she began writing and performing stand-up comedy. In 2002 she founded Leopard Productions to produce, write, and direct her own creative projects.
biography.name: Nancy Leopardi

biography.bio: David Lindmark is known for his work on That Darn Punk (2001) and 100 Ghost Street: The Return of Richard Speck (2012).
biography.name: David Lindmark

biography.bio: After breaking into acting with small roles in the feature films Fugly! (opposite John Leguizamo) and Chlorine (opposite Vincent D'Onofrio), she moved to Los Angeles to continue working in film and TV. During her first year in LA she booked the leads in six feature films. In addition to more film work Jackie has recently appeared on The Mindy Project, Westworld, Dr. Dre's upcoming series "Vital Signs", The Odd Couple, and soon to be released "Barry" (HBO) Since moving to LA, Jackie has studied improv at Groundlings, The Second City, and has trained consistently with Greg Braun since 2013. Jackie has also appeared in many publications including Cosmopolitan, Men's Fitness (interview and spread), Allure, Maxim, Loreal& FHM. She has also appeared on the Martha Stewart Show, Fox and Friends, The NBC Early Show, Access Hollywood, & was interviewed on the Howard Stern Show on January 7th, 2013 Jackie is also a trained singer, visual artist and recently co wrote her first screenplay.
biography.name: Jackie Moore

biography.bio: Chris Kane Serafin is known for his work on The Music Box (2010), 6 Ways to Die (2015) and Crash Landing (2005).
biography.name: Chris Kane Serafin

biography.bio: Jim Shipley was born on July 26, 1979 in Edwardsville, Illinois, USA as James Michael Shipley. He is an actor and composer, known for The Odd Couple (2015), Superstore (2015) and Conan (2010).
biography.name: Jim Shipley
